snippet: The F.D.A.’s stance on labeling has not changed, but it has added some confusion to the mix for consumers and for those companies that are voluntarily including more information on their packaging.
abstract: Food and Drug Administration does not favor commonly used food packaging term of non-GMO, short for genetically modified organism because it is not well defined concerning food; major food companies laud FDA's position to not require disclosure genetically engineered ingredients.
lead_paragraph: The F.D.A.’s stance on labeling has not changed, but it has added some confusion to the mix for consumers and for those companies that are voluntarily including more information on their packaging.

headline.main: F.D.A. Takes Issue With the Term ‘Non-G.M.O.’
headline.print_headline: F.D.A. Takes Issue With the Term ‘Non-G.M.O.’
